text: :snowman:

<!channel> i updated Stand Up to include a video link.  We’re  asking all to join this GVC so we can maximize the day.  Unfortunately, schedule doesn’t account for snow :confused:  Stay warm, stay safe and let us know if you can’t join or need anything!
thanks, and it looks like our meeting is at 10:30 still, not moving to 10, right?
Thx Dennis. Will skip this standup unless you need me 'there'. Cheers
Plan was to move to 10 to maximize the other side of the day, but we'll use calendar as source of truth
10:30, per usual  i idnt wanan confuse anyone and still, look what happened :confused: see y’all in 30

hey <!here|@here> just catching up on the podium notes shared out - eciting stuff.  thanks for this.  i tageged a few comments that likely have obvious answers just trying to get us all on the same page even if async.
<@U0J6TE0CA> where you at?
I cant log on just restarted computer
not computer, internet. hold on

Ah right! Thanks
come back to me.  one sec

Stand Up Topline Recap:
- Rob sharing out user stories.  Everyone jump on that so that Jira task are created in afternoon
- Rob sharing out schedule
- Elise working on Podium schematics
- Creative team needs specs but the ideas are flowing
- We’re chasing repo access and equipment info

<@U2670DYLE> <@U02E3CRMA> <@U0EL0GLEL> i don’t want this to fly past us, please reference the Content Archetype (CMS Proto Tab) we sent yesterday to client for your dB planning.  <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1nHUYv4nYsgtgeBz6augqSUlLXf8K4JeeG-tmwQDKSRk/edit?usp=sharing>

file.name: Google Net Contributor Content Audit
file.title: Google Net Contributor Content Audit - DATA MODEL

text: Headed to a coffee shop for more reliable internet, FYI y'all

yeah ive been looking at that, im going to be setting up the database architecture here soon. I did more research and found the datastore database to be lacking geo queries so you couldnt say give me articles that have a lat and lng near this one. kinda preventing the map searching feature. but app engine also offers cloud sql which is just mysql, and mysql supports these geo query function so im going to setup on that instead, will do a first pass based on the model laid out there.
thanks for laying that out so clearly <@U0EL0GLEL> so no lags on geo search but an interesting roundabout you’ve ID'd

<!here|@here> Please review User Stories. What is missing? What should not be included? Main gaps I see is logic around "displays" <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1J-9xJGA8lwggVkuN5r3yGi-K2RsQsufuZ173DYIxTRg/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/rob/F3NGKCSF7/_net_contributor__user_stories|[Net Contributor] User Stories>
and graphs/data viz. How do we start defining those?
content or the graph?
the content will be input into a google sheet
i think we need to take a look at the charts api, pick the charts we want to support
then look at the options they define
define the way we want them to look
and then on the end user, they are just giving it a data set
<@U0EL0GLEL> Possible to share the api again -
yeah just a sec
<https://developers.google.com/chart/interactive/docs/gallery>
we can use any of these, the ones that animate are the only ones that do, and that is the animation it does on show and data change
the labels are usually customizable
font size and all that
and colors are
i think we define a standard set for these per chart, and i will just pass those parameters in when the chart is initialized. along with the dataset from the user
cool thanks

The format for the sheet for inputting data we might need to dictate too, like X is column A and Y is column B for a barchart. this might change per chart type, I would like to see if very simple for the end user tho, just give us the url of the sheet and we pull the data from there

there is one caveat tho, when they save the data into our system that MUST be the last edit they do to the chart data, as Im going to pull that data at that point of save. the chart data must be stored local. I can not do it at render time without forcing an auth to gain access to the sheet. And they only way to do that is through the ui driven auth page we are used to seeing with google, since the app is front end based javascript. so i have to store the sheet data locally when they save the data since at that point in the cycle i am dealing with the node server app, and can ping the sheets api via a server key and avoid any user login to get permission to the data
oh and the user that has ownership of the sheet we are pulling from MUST be an account that we have setup, so that we will always have the correct permission to access

Thanks <@U0EL0GLEL> Do we have a .readme or other type of doc where this type of information (when they save the data into our system that MUST be the last edit they do to the chart data,) is being documented? Will help when we start doing the user documentation
not yet, this is just what i have discovered in my findings so far. if we think this approach is feasible and workable then we should write that down and proceed i think
<@U0HP6TFNX> and <@U0XJFPSRL> - note peters comment above. Seems like we should work this into the cms ux
Also, how does this sound "As a user, when I'm building a chart, I am given help text that tells me "when you click save, this must be the last edit performed"
I like the way you think <@U0260V4K1>
Yeah, I think we can probably top that flow from a ux perspective
However its performed, just want to capture the need in a story
Megan is talking to compass folks now, but I'll touch base once she's done
<@U0260V4K1> Yes, I agree this is something we should work into the cms ux. I wonder if the best placeholder spot for this is in Megan’s CMS wireframes that she finished yesterday

Thanks to <@U0ML49XU0> for getting screen dimensions. Here they are: the left and right horizontal screens (1 & 9): 55"
the left 3 portrait screens (2,3,4): 55"
the center 4 portrait screens (5,6,7,8): 65"
the kiosk: ~32"

All screens are 1920x1080
<@U0XJFPSRL> seems possible
Sure i think the ux should certainly show something about this, and the wireframe i looked at is great, it fits the mental model I had been thinking, great stuff
Updated here: <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1jg3ebDNf4B1sx2sK_EQ8-yd-lCSuF-DZA2ynlvioe2U/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/rob/F3MBC2CRG/net_contributor_exhibit_screen_details|Net Contributor Exhibit Screen Details>
ultimately my goal would be to design the UX such that there’s nothing to tell them and nothing they need to remember
just because people WILL forget and mess that up
Yep. Science of that is recognition over recall :slightly_smiling_face:
my thoughts exactly
educate your users by giving them ongoing cues based on the page they are visiting.
Can everyone :thumbsup: when they’ve reviewed, edited and signed off on user stories
I will review at about 2:30

thanks for the screen dimensions
we might know this, maybe <@U0HPGQ4KH> can help me interpret the space diagrams, but do we have an idea of what parts of the podium are ADA accessible?

ooh.  good question <@U0HP6TFNX>
trying to figure out if we need to keep touch targets within certain areas of the podium
<@U0HP6TFNX|megan> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/megan/F3QBF25K4/pasted_image_at_2017_01_11_02_10_pm.png|Pasted image at 2017-01-11, 2:10 PM>
well the podium has a screen flat on the top of it
what’s in mind for access? the touch screen? I might mock up a wheelchair in front of it and send you a screenshot.
its like a tabletop
can a wheelchair fit underneath, or will it need to be a side approach?
There’s also the area with the laptop and mobile phone on the right. Are we doing something there as well?
we’re not
<@U0HPGQ4KH>, we’re not using the stuff to the side
Love that we're considering this, good call <@U0HP6TFNX>
I believe it fits underneath but I’ll check. give me a moment
ok, thanks dennis
and thanks <@U0260V4K1>

hey team, I just chatted with <@U02E3CRMA>.  he’s hoping repo is set up by myles today.  As soon as set up, he’s going to ping James to see if we can schedule a test deploy to rig for tomorrow just to test the connection and deploy process.  IF we don’t hear from Myles in next three hours, Joel to follow up with both parties letting em know of our needs and associated plans.
we should be ready on our end - we can have them push the color test demo that Peter did early on to make sure everything is twitching
oh, we’re set?! <@U02E3CRMA> ?

hello, checked the wheelchair accesibility. 
23.6” clearance for the chair to go underneath
20.8” from front of panel to back edge of monitor (20” in your ADA image).
Looks like it is pretty accessible.
<@U0HPGQ4KH|felix> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/felix/F3QEGM7EZ/pasted_image_at_2017_01_11_14_45.png|screenshot, wheelchair>
thanks <@U0HPGQ4KH> !
<@U0ML49XU0|dennishanley> commented on <@U0HPGQ4KH|felix>’s file <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/felix/F3QEGM7EZ/pasted_image_at_2017_01_11_14_45.png|screenshot, wheelchair>: :thumbsup:
sure thing, glad the 3D model fulfills a quick check like that :wink:
i believe they had ADA in mind when creating the space. the laptop in the background is also accessible ...

<@U0HP6TFNX|megan> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/megan/F3QEK37JR/pasted_image_at_2017_01_11_02_51_pm.png|Pasted image at 2017-01-11, 2:51 PM> and commented: thanks <@U0HPGQ4KH> - if I'm reading this right, the 23.6" clearance, that doesn't clear the 27" minimum for knee clearance, so I think we need to design with a sideways reach in mind

text: I forget - dont we have a dumping ground from google of all their images? <@U0ML49XU0> <@U0B9N0HF0>
are you able to tell, from the edge of the counter, to the top of the touch screen, how many inches that is? I want to keep all controls within 24" of the front edge

i havnt seen any emails about this yet
yeah im confused now.  but hoping Joel gets it and can handle it

<@U0ML49XU0> <@U0EL0GLEL> Sorry, didn't mean to confuse. We don't have a repository yet - that's being created today by Myles. Once we have it we can check in and then push to the space. We don't have a repo yet, so nothing to do.

yeah, roger that.  <@U02E3CRMA> would you mind connecting Myles, Justin Brooks an James to the same thought via email?  Once we have repo access, we’d like to scheduel a test deploy for tomorow or Friday and find out James’ availability.  Or if too soon, maybe they set up a hangout to talk to us about it.
sure thing
:metal-hair:
<!here|@here> hows everyone feeling after a day at home?  anyone need anything?
Good on this end. elise and I reviewed wires, talked about next steps, and will be reviewing in the AM.
I'm taking a pass through user stories now
^good summary from Megan
thats great.
note out to James about test-deploy, still waiting on repo from Myles (will ping if nothing by eod). <@U0EL0GLEL> has been jamming on DB, will defer to him for update
rad, thanks for doing that joel.  just need that and equipment squared away and then we’re way less dependent on client for a little while
i have connection with the cloud sql database working, tables defined, data coming thru on the api end point
tying that all together
going to put a few of those examples from the sheet into there for test data
Doing good herre too
way to go team.  hope to see you tomorrow (also published schedule that we reviewed yesterday coming soon, rob just sent to me)
Tomorrow is going to be soooo beautiful!
<@U0EL0GLEL> did you see this item in the user stories? "As a user, I can preview the "displayed content" in browser before publishing"
Does this sound feasible?

I also want to make sure I understand your chart comments earlier today. I'm thinking the situation is, a user enters a URL from the chart they created i Google Charts, and then we store a snapshot, so if they made any other changes in the source, they're not reflected in our system. A user would need to make changes, grab a new URL, and save again. Is that the situation?

i figured out a way to allow a preview, in theory, can iframe the display and set a zoom level it will render the content rather nicely in a smaller window. i think we will be able to do it, going to need to setup a way for the display processor to take the current data model in memory and render it rather than the one passed in from the message route. I think that is probably trivial tho. since it looked pretty good from my quick test i think we should be able to do it
cool, I'll leave this story as is
Can totally leave that in the ice box too and get to it if we have enough time
i think it will be fairly trivial to implment if it goes like im thinking, but sure if we think its lower priority thats fine
thanks <@U0EL0GLEL> - that comment is about the preview not the charts, right?
yeah preview
Are you comfortable with this in the user stories "As a user, I can enter a URL to save media or a chart to a project "
and if someone needs to update a chart, they need to edit the source and re-enter the link in admin?

they are not entering a url for a chart, there is no chart builder, the chart system is just an api. you feed it data and parameters via json and a url and it dumps out a chart. there is also a more limited url chart builder where you can get a chart via giving it all the data via url, but that is very limited by the characters you can put into a url
so what happens is they give us the url of a google sheet
that is owned by an account that is associated with our system, <mailto:somethingsomething@google.com|somethingsomething@google.com> whatever owns this sheet
then they give us the url of that sheet
when they hit save on the project we would query that sheet as part of the save process
and pull a snap shot of that data
if they made a change they would just need to edit that project that had it associated and save it again to pull a new snapshot
the same would be true with media, you add that image and save and it gets uploaded to our server

Ok, trying to represent this right in the admin plan: in the CMS we store links to sheets that have data + a chart, and we have given them parameters on how to set up their charts?  At the time a project is saved in admin, we fetch the source and store a snapshot?
no chart in the sheet
just data
they just fill in the data in the sheet
so at what point does that chart get generated?
when its displayed
Do they see it/preview it somewhere?
sure in the preview window
of our CMS?
right
the display preview would show this chart and the other data as it would be displayed as this is calling basically the same function as the actual display for the wall

ok, so they create a data set like 
              column a    column b
row 1                  1                 2
row 2                  3                 4
and then they link this sheet in our URL, and select a chart type, and at that point they see what their chart looks like?
for media type they would have options like pie chart, bar chart, image, video, they select pie chart, give us the url of the sheet. then they would see that in the preview
ok, so then if they set up their data wrong and need to fix it, we would be able to give them some sort of refresh option?

we would probably want some update button for the media. since there is a preview in play here, we would need something to kick off the upload / fetch of the data. this even could be the text changed. which would work fine for the inital input but if they needed to make a change you wouldnt want to have to say oh then clear the box and put it in again

ok, it sounds like implementation details we should nail in the CMS interface. for the purpose of our user stories for Jira tracking, I think I'll generically say "As an admin user, I can enter a data source to create a chart for a project"
We can whiteboard a good interface when we're co-located
that sounds good
thanks <@U0EL0GLEL>
<@U0B9N0HF0> I am done reviewing and editing user stories for now
yeah im totally about white boarding and getting this down
Awesome! Thanks so much Megan. And thanks Peter for being on stand-by for questions
I have pared them down to features that we can track for project management purposes, without boxing us into any specific design choices
signing off for dog walks for now, thanks all
